title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document the project's scope, objectives, and functional and non-functional requirements. Conduct research on existing solutions and identify gaps or opportunities for innovation.

title: Design System Architecture for Interdisciplinary Insight Generator
description: Define the overall system architecture for the Interdisciplinary Insight Generator. This includes designing the knowledge graph structure, data ingestion pipeline, AI models, and user interfaces. Create architectural diagrams, comprehensive documentation, and provide technical details of the chosen technologies (e.g., distributed systems, containerization, microservices, and data partitioning). Consider scalability, maintainability, modularity, performance optimizations, error handling, security aspects, and edge cases. Incorporate fault tolerance, monitoring, and logging mechanisms. Define APIs and necessary integrations with third-party services. Address real-time processing, data privacy, ethical implications of AI-driven research insights, and potential solutions. Ensure that the design patterns used are clearly specified (e.g., Module and Service Locator). Update this RFC with any additional details or specifics as needed.

title: Develop Data Ingestion Pipeline
description: Implement a pipeline to collect, preprocess, and load academic data from various sources into the knowledge graph.

title: Build Knowledge Graph
description: Design and implement the knowledge graph data model and storage solution to represent academic fields, concepts, and their relationships.

title: Develop AI Models
description: Research, train, and deploy AI models for analyzing the knowledge graph, identifying connections between fields, and generating novel insights and research questions.

title: Design User Interfaces - RFC
description: This RFC proposes the design of wireframes and prototypes for user interfaces. The design should incorporate data visualization, insight exploration, and research question generation. Ensure the design is intuitive, accessible, and provides a seamless user experience. Collaborate with UX/UI designers to enhance the overall look and feel. Dependent on 'Design System Architecture' and 'Define User Personas and Use Cases'.
dependencies: Define User Personas and Use Cases

title: Implement User Interfaces
description: Develop the user interfaces based on the approved designs, integrating with the backend systems and AI models.

title: Set up CI/CD Pipeline
description: Configure a continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline for automated testing, building, and deploying the application.

title: Implement Security Measures (Revised)
description: Examine potential security risks and implement appropriate measures including authentication, authorization, data encryption, access controls, secure data storage, and secure communication protocols. Additionally, propose multi-factor authentication for increased security, periodic security audits for continuous protection, and consider integrating a user-friendly password manager for enhanced user experience. Incorporate the latest industry standards to ensure the system's security and privacy. Upon completion, document the implemented measures in the project's security documentation.

title: Conduct Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Define and execute test plans, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests, to ensure the system meets the specified requirements and functions as expected.

title: Prepare Documentation and User Guides
description: Create comprehensive documentation, including system architecture, API documentation, and user guides, to facilitate system maintenance and user onboarding.

title: Deploy and Monitor System
description: Deploy the InterdisciplinaryInsightGenerator system to a production environment, set up monitoring and logging systems, and establish processes for maintenance and updates.
